bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 29, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes about his travels to other posts to gather statistics.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 29, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your letter of July 22.
I hope Houston will
soon be through with
his teeth cutting. They
always seem to wait
for summer to come.
Some of these should
have been cut last
winter. I had a nice
little trip to Guanajoy
a few days ago. It is
twenty two miles from
here and I went in
a government conveyance
known as a “Daugherty”
drawn by four miles.

The camp there is in
the hills and prettier
than this camp as it
is in a grove of palms
and mangoes. The
drive there and back
was delightful.

I am about to make
a trip to Pinar the camp
near Pinar del Rio which
is a hundred an ten miles
from here near the western end
of the island. I shall go by train
this time. I am glad to have
these opportunities to see the Country.

I make these trips to get statistics
which we have found it impossible
to get by letter from the post
surgeons. The records have
to be gone over

As you say nothing of hot weather
I suppose you are escaping
what they talk so much about
in the papers.

I forgot to mention your letter of
the 19th which came since I wrote last.

It is awfully nice for Houston to
be out of doors so much.
I wish I could see the little chop.
